newsitem.title: USA: NRC adds five U.S. nuclear plants to its watchlist. [CORRECTED 20:43 GMT]
newsitem.headline: NRC adds five U.S. nuclear plants to its watchlist. [CORRECTED 20:43 GMT]

text.p: The Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) announced Wednesday it has added five power plants to its watchlist of units requiring increased regulatory attention to ensure their safe and reliable operation.
The additions bring the list's total to eight facilities.

"The plants were placed on the NRC watch list earlier this month at a meeting during which senior NRC managers conducted their semi-annual review of the performance of operating power plants and fuel cycle facilities," the NRC said in a statement.

The five latest additions to the watch list are: - Crystal River 3 (741 megawatts), Citrus County, Fla., operated by Florida Power Corp - LaSalle units 1 and 2, (1,078 MW each), Seneca, Ill., operated by Commonwealth Edison - Maine Yankee (910 MW), Wiscasset, Me., operated by Maine Yankee Atomic Power Co, a consortium of Northeast utilities - Salem units 1 and 2 (1,106 MW each), Salem, N.J., operated by Public Service Electric & Gas, a unit of Public Service Enterprise Group, Inc. (Corrects from "...a unit of General Public Utilities Corp")
- Zion units 1 and 2, (1,040 MW each), Zion, Ill., operated by Commonwealth Edison Co
